Word-wrapping in treeviews and item views, adapted from David Meyer's implementation.

summary.raw: Set add new global item to monospace font.
summary.html: Set add new global item to monospace font.

summary.raw:
Fix slightly incorrect editor padding calculation - can be a real number and
should exclude one pixel in between cells. Calculated this way, text does not
jump on either Windows or Linux.
summary.html:
Fix slightly incorrect editor padding calculation - can be a real number and
should exclude one pixel in between cells. Calculated this way, text does not
jump on either Windows or Linux.

values.message:
Fix slightly incorrect editor padding calculation - can be a real number and
should exclude one pixel in between cells. Calculated this way, text does not
jump on either Windows or Linux.

summary.raw: Ensure editor font size identical to tableview/treeview font size
summary.html: Ensure editor font size identical to tableview/treeview font size

values.message: Ensure editor font size identical to tableview/treeview font size

summary.raw:
Restore padding to globals when they have multiple lines, rather than just
being their minimum height. Set margin of editor to stop the text from jumping
when entering/exiting editing. (this does not fix the name jumping to the top
when there is a multi-line value. It prevents single-line names/values and
multiline values from jumping.
summary.html:

being their minimum height. Set margin of editor to stop the text from jumping
when entering/exiting editing. (this does not fix the name jumping to the top
when there is a multi-line value. It prevents single-line names/values and
multiline values from jumping.

values.message:
Restore padding to globals when they have multiple lines, rather than just
being their minimum height. Set margin of editor to stop the text from jumping
when entering/exiting editing. (this does not fix the name jumping to the top
when there is a multi-line value. It prevents single-line names/values and
multiline values from jumping.

summary.raw:
Get rid of the special casing of the expansion column for tab navigation
It didn't achieve much and was confusing.
Make enter and space edit editable items (with space not erasing the contents)

It didn't achieve much and was confusing.

It didn't achieve much and was confusing.

summary.raw:
Fix bug with spurious error being printed to the terminal
when runmanager automatically goes into edit mode for the value or
units column because they are blank. The error was caused by the tableview
already being in edit mode, so it can't go into edit mode again.
summary.html:
Fix bug with spurious error being printed to the terminal
when runmanager automatically goes into edit mode for the value or
units column because they are blank. The error was caused by the tableview
already being in edit mode, so it can't go into edit mode again.

values.message:
Fix bug with spurious error being printed to the terminal
when runmanager automatically goes into edit mode for the value or
units column because they are blank. The error was caused by the tableview
already being in edit mode, so it can't go into edit mode again.

brightened by alternate-row highlighting. This improves visiblity of
rows.

summary.raw:
Lighter, semitransparent selection highlighting in globals tab.
Same selection colour used in other treeviews.
Make axes tab use alternating row colours and same treeview as groups tab.
Set minimum size to rows to prevent flickering when icons come and go during evaluation

summary.raw:
Word-wrapping in treeviews and item views, adapted from David Meyer's implementation.

Swapped the globals treeview for a tableview. This involved replacing the custom
treeview with a mixin class, so that it could be reused for both the new tableview
and the existing treeviews.

This was because TableViews have automatic vertical resizing of rows to contents,
whereas treeviews do not.

Added a custom editor for globals that also has word wrapping and expands
vertically when wrapping occurs. The editor is a QTextEdit instead of a QPlainTextEdit
because QPlainTextEdit has worse resizing semantics, preferring to return sizes in
number of lines instead of pixels, and always having one additional blank line
of space reported in its size. QTextEdit is simple enough to use instead, we
just have to explicitly say we want to set and get plain text only.

Disabled resizing of all columns that were still possible to resize. All columns
are not set to their minimum width except for one column in each view that is
set to stretch, which in the case of the globals view is the value column.

Most of the diff is noise of variable renamings due to changing the treeview
for a tableview, and boilerplate changes due to using a mixin. The changes of
substance are the new TableView class definition, the new Editor class defintion,
and some changes to the ItemDelegate (which I also simplified to not use
font metrics in its height calculation). The other meaningful changes are setting
a stretch section for the views and setting all other sections to minimum column
width.
summary.html:
Word-wrapping in treeviews and item views, adapted from David Meyer's implementation.

Swapped the globals treeview for a tableview. This involved replacing the custom
treeview with a mixin class, so that it could be reused for both the new tableview
and the existing treeviews.

This was because TableViews have automatic vertical resizing of rows to contents,
whereas treeviews do not.

Added a custom editor for globals that also has word wrapping and expands
vertically when wrapping occurs. The editor is a QTextEdit instead of a QPlainTextEdit
because QPlainTextEdit has worse resizing semantics, preferring to return sizes in
number of lines instead of pixels, and always having one additional blank line
of space reported in its size. QTextEdit is simple enough to use instead, we
just have to explicitly say we want to set and get plain text only.

Disabled resizing of all columns that were still possible to resize. All columns
are not set to their minimum width except for one column in each view that is
set to stretch, which in the case of the globals view is the value column.

Most of the diff is noise of variable renamings due to changing the treeview
for a tableview, and boilerplate changes due to using a mixin. The changes of
substance are the new TableView class definition, the new Editor class defintion,
and some changes to the ItemDelegate (which I also simplified to not use
font metrics in its height calculation). The other meaningful changes are setting
a stretch section for the views and setting all other sections to minimum column
width.

values.message:
Word-wrapping in treeviews and item views, adapted from David Meyer's implementation.

Swapped the globals treeview for a tableview. This involved replacing the custom
treeview with a mixin class, so that it could be reused for both the new tableview
and the existing treeviews.

This was because TableViews have automatic vertical resizing of rows to contents,
whereas treeviews do not.

Added a custom editor for globals that also has word wrapping and expands
vertically when wrapping occurs. The editor is a QTextEdit instead of a QPlainTextEdit
because QPlainTextEdit has worse resizing semantics, preferring to return sizes in
number of lines instead of pixels, and always having one additional blank line
of space reported in its size. QTextEdit is simple enough to use instead, we
just have to explicitly say we want to set and get plain text only.

Disabled resizing of all columns that were still possible to resize. All columns
are not set to their minimum width except for one column in each view that is
set to stretch, which in the case of the globals view is the value column.

Most of the diff is noise of variable renamings due to changing the treeview
for a tableview, and boilerplate changes due to using a mixin. The changes of
substance are the new TableView class definition, the new Editor class defintion,
and some changes to the ItemDelegate (which I also simplified to not use
font metrics in its height calculation). The other meaningful changes are setting
a stretch section for the views and setting all other sections to minimum column
width.
